b0896ffb-8e11-461d-8b86-eecab6846974.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of Management Systems Auditing; including ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14001:2015, and ISO 45001:2018 both as integrated and standalone systems. Earners have a demonstrated understanding of conducting integrated management systems audits as a Lead Auditor, working with and managing audit team members. They are competent in skills such as audit planning, chairing opening and closing meetings, communicating with audit team members and auditees.
b0896ffb-8e11-461d-8b86-eecab6846974.name: Lead Auditor Integrated Management Systems

alignments.name: ISO 19011:2018
alignments.description: This standard provides guidance on auditing management systems (MS), including the principles of auditing, managing an audit programme and conducting MS audits, evaluation of competence of individuals involved in the audit process. These activities include the individual(s) managing the audit programme, auditors and audit teams.

alignments.name: ISO 9001:2015
alignments.description: ISO 9001 specifies requirements for a quality management system. Including processes for system improvement, assurance of conformity to customer & applicable statutory/regulatory requirements. The requirements of ISO 9001 are generic and are intended to be applicable to any organization, regardless of type, size, or products and services provided.

alignments.name: ISO 14001:2015
alignments.description: ISO 14001 specifies the requirements for an environmental management system that an organization can use to enhance its environmental performance. It is intended for use by an organization seeking to manage its environmental responsibilities in a systematic manner that contributes to the environmental pillar of sustainability.

alignments.name: ISO 45001:2018
alignments.description: ISO 45001 is applicable to any organization that wishes to establish, implement and maintain an OH&S system. Including eliminating hazards, minimize OH&S risks, take advantage of OH&S opportunities, and address OH&S management system nonconformities associated with its activities; regardless of organizational type, size, and services provided.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Auditor Training Online Lead Auditor Integrated Management Systems course.

Achieve a 100% pass mark in all knowledge and performance-based assessments delivered by ATOL Training as per the evidence requirements and performance criteria of the below-listed training package/s and competency unit/s.
Competency Unit: Exemplar Global Auditing Management Systems (AU)
Competency Unit: Exemplar Global Lead Audit Teams (TL)
Competency Unit: Exemplar Global Quality Management Systems Auditing (QM)
Competency Unit: Exemplar Global Environmental Management Systems Auditing (EM)
Competency Unit: Exemplar Global OH&S Management Systems Auditing (OH45001)

d13cc887-e69d-4750-8868-9b4fc2d6cb13.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge and ability to Develop and Audit HACCP Plans as a Lead Auditor, working with and managing an audit team member. They have an understanding of HACCP requirements, including topics such as; legal and ethical aspects of HACCP, Developing HACCP Plans, HACCP implementation based on Codex guidelines, procedures for reviewing HACCP plans, conducting & planning audits, chairing audit meetings and interviews, and communicating with audit participants.
d13cc887-e69d-4750-8868-9b4fc2d6cb13.name: HACCP Practitioner & Lead Auditor

alignments.name: Codex Alimentarius
alignments.description: The Codex Alimentarius is a collection of internationally adopted food standards and related texts presented in a uniform manner. These food standards and related texts aim at protecting consumers’ health and ensuring fair practices in the international food trade.

Competency Unit: Exemplar Global Quality Management Systems Auditing (QM)

6875af4e-09e6-40d7-ade4-71f3ce10d704.description: Earners of this badge have completed an online introductory course on the topic of Integrated Management Systems; including ISO 9001:2015, ISO 14001:2015, and ISO 45001:2018 both as integrated and standalone systems. Earners of this badge have not been tested on their knowledge and/or understanding of this content.
6875af4e-09e6-40d7-ade4-71f3ce10d704.name: Introduction to Integrated Management Systems

alignments.name: ISO 19011:2018
alignments.description: This standard provides guidance on auditing management systems (MS), including the principles of auditing, managing an audit programme and conducting MS audits, evaluation of competence of individuals involved in the audit process. These activities include the individual(s) managing the audit programme, auditors and audit teams.

alignments.name: ISO 9001:2015
alignments.description: ISO 9001 specifies requirements for a quality management system. Including processes for system improvement, assurance of conformity to customer & applicable statutory/regulatory requirements. The requirements of ISO 9001 are generic and are intended to be applicable to any organization, regardless of type, size, or products and services provided.

alignments.name: ISO 14001:2015
alignments.description: ISO 14001 specifies the requirements for an environmental management system that an organization can use to enhance its environmental performance. It is intended for use by an organization seeking to manage its environmental responsibilities in a systematic manner that contributes to the environmental pillar of sustainability.

alignments.name: ISO 45001:2018
alignments.description: ISO 45001 is applicable to any organization that wishes to establish, implement and maintain an OH&S system. Including eliminating hazards, minimize OH&S risks, take advantage of OH&S opportunities, and address OH&S management system nonconformities associated with its activities; regardless of organizational type, size, and services provided.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the ATOL Understanding Integrated Management Systems course.

5f235038-7d3a-4522-8673-53ed7b901c27.description: Earners of this badge have completed an online introductory course on the topic of Management Systems Auditing. This introductory course includes topics such as; Audit Fundamentals, Principles, Personal Behaviours, planning, procedures, Reports, Communicating with The Audit Team & Auditee, Document Reviews, Audit Objectives Scope & Criteria, and the Roles & Responsibilities Of The Auditor. Earners on this badge have not been tested on their knowledge and/or understanding of this content.
5f235038-7d3a-4522-8673-53ed7b901c27.name: Introduction to Management Systems Audits

alignments.name: ISO 19011:2018
alignments.description: This standard provides guidance on auditing management systems (MS), including the principles of auditing, managing an audit programme and conducting MS audits, evaluation of competence of individuals involved in the audit process. These activities include the individual(s) managing the audit programme, auditors and audit teams.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the ATOL Understanding Management Systems Audit course

6e3499ec-3082-431c-9dee-ea39805837c6.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge and ability to Develop and Internal Audit HACCP Plans. They have an understanding of HACCP requirements, including topics such as; legal and ethical aspects of HACCP, Developing HACCP Plans, HACCP implementation based on Codex guidelines, procedures for reviewing HACCP plans, conducting internal audits, internal audit planning, chairing audit meetings and interviews and communicating with internal audit participants at all different levels.
6e3499ec-3082-431c-9dee-ea39805837c6.name: HACCP Practitioner & Internal Audit Team Member

alignments.name: Codex Alimentarius
alignments.description: The Codex Alimentarius is a collection of internationally adopted food standards and related texts presented in a uniform manner. These food standards and related texts aim at protecting consumers’ health and ensuring fair practices in the international food trade.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the ATOL Internal Auditor HACCP Practitioner course.

Achieve a 100% pass mark in all knowledge and performance-based assessments delivered by ATOL Training as per the evidence requirements and performance criteria of the relevant training package/s and competency unit/s.
Competency Unit: Exemplar Global Developing HACCP Plans (HP)
Competency Unit: Exemplar Global Auditing Management Systems (AU)

73367237-62a0-4468-9e5c-186fa83c950b.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated knowledge of ISO 14001:2015; as well as conducting management systems audits as an Internal Audit Team Member. They are competent in skills such as internal audit planning, communicating with audit team members and auditees at all different levels, the context of the organization, documented information, continual improvement, operational planning, environmental aspects, risks and opportunities.
73367237-62a0-4468-9e5c-186fa83c950b.name: Internal Auditor Environmental Management Systems
